Legal_Issue: Availability of state protection in Colombia
Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Type: Evidence of FARC threats, judicial inefficiency in Colombia
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Presumption of state protection in urban areas like Bogotá
Evidence_Ignored: Applicants' argument that Board ignored evidence of FARC threats and judicial inefficiency
Application_Factor: Applicants failed to rebut presumption of state protection
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding adequate state protection
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Under IRPA, applicants must prove inadequate state protection with clear and convincing evidence
Cause_of_Refusal: State protection deemed available in Colombia
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide sufficient evidence to overcome presumption of state protection
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board’s determination on state protection
Jurisdictional_Focus: Colombia, specifically urban areas such as Bogotá
